title: Ahmedabad Air India crash: Supreme Court seeks response of Centre, DGCA on PIL seeking independent probe
content: A bench of Justices Surya Kant and N Kotiswar Singh took note of certain aspects of the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) preliminary report issued on July 12

title: At least four killed, three injured as unidentified vehicle rams into stationary SUV in U.P.'s Prayagraj

title: Kerala govt picks holes in NGT panel report recommending increase in safety distance from quarries
content: Kerala government’s report to Principal Bench of NGT claims there is no need to enhance present regulatory distance of 50 metres between quarries and residential areas. The panel had recommended a safety distance of 150 m

title: South Calcutta Law College rape case: DNA, CCTV evidence corroborate key accused's role

title: NIA arrests 2 men for involvement in minor Bangladeshi girl's trafficking

title: Next-Gen GST reforms testament to PM Modi’s resolve to serve poor, farmers, says Amit Shah

title: 1xBet online betting app case: Cricketer Robin Uthappa appears before Enforcement Directorate
content: “The ED will question him and record his statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act in a case linked to a platform named 1xBet,” the officials said

title: Congress MP Rajmohan Unnithan welcomes dismissal of defamation case by K.P. Sasikala, vows to continue ‘fight against hatred’

content: The technology would be especially helpful for stations where multiple vehicles need to charge simultaneously

title: Mysuru Dasara 2025: Stage set for inauguration of festivities amid tight security
content: Visitors including the media had to pass through several layers of security to reach the venue of inauguration. Visitors were not only asked to show their identity cards, but also frisked at the venue.

title: How Trump’s H-1B fee threatens India’s IT firms and Big Tech business models
content: If American companies cannot economically hire foreign workers for onshore roles, they may shift entire operations overseas

content: A Delhi High Court Bench had dismissed the bail pleas of the nine accused, holding that their roles in the conspiracy  appeared “prima facie grave”

title: Establishment of 10th Assam Police battalion approved by cabinet
content: The questions under the ‘Comprehension’ part of the General Studies Paper-II, however, will be set only in English

content: The protesters alleged gross negligence on the part of the college dean Dr. Arvind Ghanghoria and MYH Superintendent Dr. Ashok Yadav

title: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar to meet U.S. Secretary of State Rubio in New York today
content: This will be the first face-to-face meeting between Mr. Rubio and Mr. Jaishankar following President Donald Trump's imposition of an additional 25% tariff on India for Delhi's purchases of Russian oil, taking the total levies imposed on India by the Trump White House to 50%

title: Can timelines be fixed for Governors? | Explained
content: Can the Governor withhold assent to a Bill passed by the State legislature based on his own discretion? Why has the Centre said that courts cannot prescribe a timeline for Governors/President to decide on a Bill? What have Opposition-rule States said on the matter?

title: If party asks me to contest election, I am ready even at midnight, says Samrat Choudhary
content: The former party State president who is also the leader of the BJP Legislature Party said that seat sharing arrangements would be done soon

title: GST reforms LIVE: Next-Gen GST reforms testament to PM Modi’s resolve to serve poor and farmers, says Amit Shah
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the auspicious period is special this time as it will render the mantra of ‘swadeshi’ a new energy along with the “GST-saving festival”

title: Row over level crossing kept open near Katpadi despite express train approaching it
content: Road users argue with gateman, accuse him of compromising on safety guidelines. According to sources, the gateman was unaware of the approaching express train as a telecommunication failure had disrupted contact between him and the Station Master from where the train departed

title: Passenger booked after revolver, cartridges recovered from his bag at Pune airport
content: Chandrakant Prabhakar Bagal was scheduled to board a Pune-Varanasi flight when the weapon and ammunition were detected during baggage screening at Level 2B of the airport, a police official said

title: NCW member visits Panskura hospital in West Bengal where female staff was raped by colleague
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee accuses that NCW visits Bengal for the smallest of incidents but they turn a blind eye when things happen in BJP ruled States

title: Clash with police in Uttar Pradesh’s Dadri for stopping Mahapanchayat; 22 booked
content: Police have filed a case against 22 named individuals and others in connection with the incident after denying any instance of stone pelting

title: No gang involvement found in service selection exam paper leak case: Uttarakhand Police
content: The commission had earlier sought a detailed police probe into the matter, with its chairman Ganesh Singh Martolia admitting that three pages of the question paper has been leaked from a centre

title: With election looming, Nitish sweetens deal for Bihar’s welfare workers
content: 10,000 Vikas Mitras to get one-time allowance of ₹25,000 each to buy tablets; they play a key role in delivering development, welfare schemes to SCs, STs: CM

title: Wife of Congress leader file complaint over cyberbullying
content: A special investigation team (SIT) headed by Munambam DySP S. Jayakrishnan, is probing the case registered over Ms. Shine’s complaint

title: Clamour to augment general coaches on trains, MEMU rakes grows louder in Kerala
content: Delay in national highway expansion works has forced more inter-district passengers to rely on rail services, leading to worsening congestion on trains passing through Ernakulam

title: Vijay is slandering DMK government, says VCK MLA Aloor Shanavas
content: Alleging that the crowds that gather to see the TVK founder were there for his ‘star power’, he remarks that Vijay’s claim that he is putting the DMK government on the backfoot with his ‘questions’ is absurd

title: Congress legislators, functionaries want coalition government in Tamil Nadu: S. Rajeshkumar
content: The Tamil Nadu Congress Legislative Party Leader says they will urge the All India Congress Committee leadership to seek more seats in the 2026 Assembly election

title: Terry Fox Run held to raise funds for cancer research
content: Participants of all ages joined the 3 km and 6 km events to raise awareness and funds for cancer research

title: Man held for pledging fake gold jewellery in Tirupattur
content: After tracking the suspect through CCTV footage and mobile phone tower signals, police apprehended him at his hideout in Hosur town.

title: Tribal women in Jawadhu Hills learn to make fruit jams, squash, juices using locally grown tamarind
content: Tribals from at least ten remote hamlets that come under Kovilur and Nammiyampattu village panchayats in the hills attended the day-long training at the centre.

title: Watch: “No one in Bihar is protesting SIR, it’s just Delhi noise” – Sanjay K Jha | The Hindu Mind
content: In this episode of The Hindu Mind, JDU Working President Sanjay K. Jha makes bold revelations on Bihar’s political future. He shares how Nitish Kumar offered the CM post to BJP in 2020, discusses the impact of double-engine government, and explains why the 2025 election is about Bihar’s next 25 years. Jha also speaks on Nishant Kumar’s political role, electoral roll revision, and how women voters transformed Bihar’s politics. With a deep dive into governance, caste arithmetic, and alliances, this is a must-watch conversation ahead of the 2025 Bihar Assembly polls.

title: Daughter ignites fresh feud in Lalu family ahead of Bihar election
content: According to the sources in the RJD, Rohini Acharya is unhappy over the expanding influence of Sanjay Yadav, the political advisor to Tejashwi Yadav, in the party; there is speculation that Rohini believes Sanjay is behind the party not entertaining her idea to contest in the upcoming election

title: 5,000 police deployed in Vijayawada for smooth conduct of Dasara festivities
content: The Endowments, Vijayawada Municipal Corporation, Police, Revenue, A.P. Transco, State Disaster Response Force, Medical and Health and other Departments to monitor the situation round-the-clock

title: A mixed bag of gloom, hope in Kerala’s IT sector over H-1B visa fee hike
content: The hike from $5,000 to $1,00,000 is bound to affect even large IT services companies. The scope for business expansion too will come down. However, experts feel that U.S. companies will set up more global capability centres in India, manned by their own people with expertise, which will benefit tier-2 cities

title: MP Engineer Rashid completed 30 hours of hunger strike in jail: Awami Ittehad Party
content: “Protest is to call out hypocrisy of both India, Pak. governments which are busy celebrating cricket diplomacy, while ignoring the pain, sacrifices and human rights of people of Jammu and Kashmir,” says AIP

title: ‘We fear big industries and outsiders will occupy our land’
content: Cherring Dorjay Lakruk, the president of the powerful Ladakh Buddhist Association and co-convenor of the Leh Apex Body, says that “outsiders will take away all our businesses”

title: Common man suffering due to ‘dual power structure’ in J&K: Congress
content: The Lt. Governor’s office and the CM’s office do not work in coordination and act on their own without concern for people’s difficulties, says Senior Congress leader Ghulam Ahmad Mir. Statehood for J&K has not been restored despite the Centre’s promise to do that after holding Assembly elections, he says

title: Embassy in Guatemala concerned about Indians illegally entering Central America
content: In a bid to reach the U.S. via Mexico, Indian nationals have unlawfully entered Guatemala, EI Salvador, and Honduras; when they are arrested, the Embassy offers translation help and well-being support

title: BJP’s Jagdambika Pal takes a dig at Rahul Gandhi’s ‘vote theft’ allegations
content: The BJP MP said the Congress leader’s claims were baseless, and that Rahul Gandhi’s fight favours foreigners, not Indian voters

title: Sankaracharya University authorities deny Governor’s charge that Adi Sankara’s pictures are not allowed in the varsity
content: Authorities say pictures of the seer are prominently displayed in the offices of the Vice-Chancellor, Registrar and other important places in the institution

title: End of an Era: IAF to retire iconic MiG-21 on September 26
content: The aircraft was the backbone of the IAF till the mid-2000s, playing crucial roles in the 1965 and 1971 wars, the 1999 Kargil conflict, the 2019 Balakot air strikes, and most recently Operation Sindoor

title: It’s settled that Nitish Kumar is the face of the Bihar NDA and will be Chief Minister: JD(U) working president Sanjay K. Jha
content: When JD(U) slipped to third place in 2020 with just 43 seats, Mr. Jha recounts that Nitish had offered the CM’s chair to the BJP; in turn, BJP entrusted Mr. Kumar with the job as the poll was fought in his name

title: Peace important, responsibility must be fulfilled by those in-charge: Omar Abdullah
content: J&K leader says peace is prerequisite for tourism, sports and development; launches Real Kashmir FC’s ‘Peace Jersey’ in Srinagar

content: Mr. Bera is a Democrat member of the House of Representatives, and an Indian American; his delegation has been invited to India to meet government officials and industry leaders in Delhi and Mumbai

title: Bathukamma festivities commence with pomp and gaiety in Warangal
content: Deputy CM inaugurates Telangana’s unique floral festival at the historic Thousand Pillar Temple in Hanamkonda; women offer prayers with vibrant floral offerings

title: Watch: GST rate cut kicks in from September 22, goods and services to become cheaper
content: About 99% of goods under the 12% GST slab currently will move to 5%. The rejig will also result in 90% items under 28% tax slab coming down to 18% bracket

title: Fishers’ forum seeks action on CMLRE findings on shipwreck
content: The State govt. urged to examine the gravity of the findings and take legal and preventive measures based on the report

title: Andhra Pradesh bags ‘Best State Award’ for silk development
content: The award, instituted under the ‘Mera Resham - Mera Abhiman’ programme of the Central Silk Board, is for effectively creating awareness among silk growers

title: Followers of Basaveshwara urged to mention Lingayat as their religion in survey
content: It is crucial to gaining religious minority status for Lingayats, according to Jagatika Lingayat Mahasabha

title: Guwahati unites in grief as fans pay last respects to Zubeen Garg
content: Fans line streets as singer’s mortal remains reach city; cremation to be held at Hatimura in Sonapur on September 23

title: Politics over Durga Puja picks up in West Bengal
content: While Mamata Banerjee referred to harassment of migrants during Durga Puja inauguration, Opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari accused the CM of inaugurating pujas before Mahalaya, a departure from Hindu tradition

title: Priyanka meets Jifri Thangal
content: The AICC general secretary’s visit is seen as politically significant as there are fissures within the Samastha over relations with the IUML, a major constituent of the Congress-led UDF.

title: Socio-educational survey in Karnataka is an attempt to divide Hinduism, says Ashok
content: Alleging that the socio-educational survey which is being held from Monday in Karnataka was an ‘attempt to divide Hinduism’, Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly R. Ashok has urged Ministers opposing the survey to quit

title: ED conducts searches related to a Delhi-based group under FEMA
content: The searches were related to alleged undisclosed assets held outside India, worth about ₹80 crore, in Singapore, Dubai, the British Virgin Islands, and Thailand

title: Big questions from NFL Week 3: How concerning is Cowboys' defense? Did Chiefs' offense find something?
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 3.

content: Do the Bengals need QB help? Should the Eagles throw the ball way more? We sized up Week 3 overreactions.

title: Source: RB Conner suffers season-ending injury
content: Cardinals running back James Conner suffered a season-ending right ankle injury during Sunday's loss to the 49ers, and he will require surgery, a source told ESPN.

title: Chiefs get 1st win as Reid brushes off Kelce dustup
content: Chiefs coach Andy Reid brushed off his sideline dustup with Travis Kelce on Sunday night as Kansas City picked up its first win of the season, beating the Giants.

title: Chargers' Harris carted off with Achilles injury
content: Chargers running back Najee Harris had what preliminary tests revealed was an Achilles injury during Sunday's 23-20 win against the Denver Broncos, coach Jim Harbaugh said after the game.

title: Wilson booed amid chants for Dart in Giants' loss
content: The Giants fell to 0-3 on Sunday with a 22-9 loss to the Chiefs. Russell Wilson, who threw two interceptions, endured chants of "We want Dart!" from the crowd, as fans made it clear they want to see rookie Jaxson Dart under center.

title: Mayfield calls Jets win personal, points to Wilks
content: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield didn't hold back when asked about the significance of a 29-27 victory over the Jets on Sunday.

title: Raleigh's 58th HR fuels Mariners' sweep of Astros
content: Mariners star Cal Raleigh hit his MLB-leading 58th home run Sunday night as Seattle completed a three-game sweep of Houston.

title: Browns stun Pack with big block, then 55-yard FG
content: The previously winless Browns beat the previously unbeaten Packers for the biggest upset of the NFL season to date, with Shelby Harris' field goal block and Andre Szmyt 55-yard make proving pivotal for Cleveland.

title: OSU lands S Smith, brother of star Buckeyes WR
content: Class of 2027 safety Angelo Smith, the brother of Ohio State star wide receiver Jeremiah Smith, has committed to the Buckeyes, a source confirmed to ESPN.

content: Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet on the Indiana Hoosiers after their 63-10 win over No. 9 Illinois.

content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: ⚾ Dodgers' Clayton Kershaw to retire after season
content: Clayton Kershaw, a three-time National League Cy Young Award winner and 11-time All-Star with the Dodgers, will retire after this season. "I'm at peace with it," he said. "I think it's the right time."

title: 🎤 Johnson: Not giving 'trade secrets' to Brady
content: Ben Johnson isn't worried about divulging information that can be used against the Bears when he participates in production meetings with Tom Brady.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Buy the dip: Thirteen players primed for bounce-back seasons
content: These fantasy hockey players underwhelmed last season, but could return to better production this year.

title: Debris Of Pak Missile Fired During Op Sindoor Found In Dal Lake, Defused
content: The debris of a Pakistani missile has been found in Dal Lake in Jammu and Kashmir. The missile found on Sunday, during a clean-up drive, was launched during Operation Sindoor in May.

title: Chinese Businesswoman Gives Rs 3.6 Crore To Employee To Settle Divorce
content: A Chinese businesswoman, smitten with her younger married employee, gave him 3 million yuan, approximately Rs 3.6 crore, to help him divorce his wife and compensate her.

title: 30 Killed As Pak Air Force Drops 8 Bombs On Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Village
content: At least 30 people, including women and children, were killed in airstrikes by the Pakistani Air Force in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province on Monday.

title: US Woman In ICU After Neighbour Accidentally Fires Gun Through Ceiling
content: Caleb Bean told authorities that he "accidentally discharged his firearm while attempting to cycle the action of his rifle".

title: Opinion: Opinion | The One Place Where China's Popularity Is Sky High: Karishma Vaswani
content: When the US steps back, China moves in. Beijing is making significant inroads in Africa, using a combination of investment and soft power in a region that's now a vital player in the global contest for resources.

title: Delhi College Principal Suspended After Sexual Harassment Complaint
content: The principal of a college affiliated with the University of Delhi has been suspended after a faculty member accused him of harassment

title: Opinion: Opinion | Ports, Power, And The Perils Of Reform: A Parliamentarian's Reflection
content: The legislative trifecta - the Indian Ports Act, 2025; the Merchant Shipping Act, 2025; and the Coastal Shipping Act, 2025 - was passed in a session marred by disruption, without meaningful debate or scrutiny.

title: Video: Speeding Lamborghini Crashes Into Coastal Road Divider In Mumbai
content: A speeding high-end Lamborghini car rammed into the divider of the Coastal Road in Mumbai, officials said on Monday. The sports car driver escaped unhurt in the incident, which occurred on Sunday morning, an official said.

title: Trump Administration To Link Tylenol To Autism, Says Report
content: Trump administration officials plan to link the active ingredient in Tylenol to autism Monday, the Washington Post reported, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.

title: UP Man Dies Of Snakebite While Filming Video
content: A 24-year-old man died after being bitten by a snake he had draped around his neck while recording a video in the Bhopa area here, police said on Monday.

title: Delhi-Bound Air India Plane Returns To London Airport From Taxiway As Flier Fails To Board
content: Air India said the passenger had mistakenly proceeded to the arrivals area instead of the departure gate.

title: Writer Banu Mushtaq Inaugurates Dasara Festival In Mysuru
content: The famous Mysuru Dasara festival commenced in the city and palaces on Monday with religious and traditional fervour, with International Booker Prize-winning writer Banu Mushtaq inaugurating the festivities.

title: India Plans 'Bodyguard' Satellites After Risky Orbital Near-Miss: Report
content: India is developing a plan to improve its ability to protect satellites from attacks, people familiar with the matter said, after a near miss in orbit highlighted risks to national security posed by other spacecraft.

title: North Korea's Kim Open To Trump Talks If US Drops Denuclearisation Demands
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un says he has "fond memories" of US President Donald Trump and is open to future talks with the United States -- if he can keep his nukes.

title: New GST Rates Live Updates: GST 2.0 Takes Effect, Food, Cars, TVs Become Cheaper
content: GST 2.0 Rates LIVE Updates: The new Goods and Services Tax (GST) rates have taken effect today, with many items, including daily food and essentials, as well as life and health insurance policies, becoming cheaper.

title: "Trust-Based Tax System": Amit Shah To NDTV On New GST Structure
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has said the new GST structure, which came into effect today, is a "trust-based tax system" that would increase both production and consumption in the country.

title: "One Day PoK Will Say 'Main Bharat Hoon'": Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday expressed confidence in India getting back control of Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) without taking any aggressive steps, as the people in the region itself have been demanding freedom from the current admini

title: Forced To Consume Alcohol, Pay Bill By Seniors, Hyderabad Student Kills Self
content: Jadav Sai Teja, a 22-year-old engineering student at the Siddharth Engineering College in Hyderabad, was found hanging inside his hostel room. Sai Teja was reportedly a victim of ragging.

title: Amid Trump's H-1B Chaos, China Opens Door For Global Talent With 'K Visa'
content: As US President Donald Trump's new $100,000 visa fee sets off panic and confusion, China has announced a new visa category to lure in young science and technology talent.

title: US Announces $1,00,000 Fee For New H-1B Petitions After September 21
content: All new H-1B visa petitions submitted after September 21, including those for the FY2026 lottery, will require payment of the USD 100,000 fee, as announced by President Donald Trump in a recent proclamation, the US government has said.

title: India had 'BrahMos' to Pakistan's 'AK47': Ex-PAK spinner on 'maha dhulai'; lauds Abhishek-Gill
content: Danish Kaneria criticized Pakistan's Asia Cup loss to India, highlighting the destructive opening partnership of Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill, who made a mockery of Pakistan's 171/5. Kaneria lauded the Indian openers' aggressive counterattack, which left Pakistan's bowlers clueless. He also dismissed Fakhar Zaman's potential complaints about his dismissal, asserting it was a clean catch.

title: 'I have killed my wife': UP man slits wife’s throat in front of kids
content: In a fit of rage fueled by suspicion, Kishan Sharma murdered his wife, Chanchal, in their Dadri home, slitting her throat in front of their two young children. Following the gruesome act, Kishan himself contacted the police to confess. Authorities arrived to find him beside Chanchal's body, with the traumatized children nearby, confirming his confession and initiating a murder investigation.

title: ‘Most MBAs outdated’, says Anupam Mittal; advises youth to learn building product
content: Anupam Mittal, Shark Tank judge, believes traditional MBAs are outdated, advocating for practical product-building skills. He emphasizes learning to question norms, empathize with customers, and influence without authority. Mittal suggests young professionals become product managers, engineers, or designers to thrive in the 21st century, mastering both building and storytelling.

title: H-1B alternatives: O1 & L1 visas gain traction; check cost, approval rates
content: Following the surge in H-1B visa fees, legal experts predict a rise in L1 and O1 visa applications, presenting financially viable alternatives. While O1 and L1 visas have stringent eligibility criteria, organizations are expected to steer recruits toward these options.

title: AK47 to Jets: How India vs Pakistan fixture had political undertones
content: During the Asia Cup Super 4s match between India and Pakistan, Pakistani players Farhan and Rauf made controversial gestures. Farhan's gun-like bat celebration and Rauf's provocative signal towards Indian fans sparked criticism. Rauf's gesture referenced unverified claims of downing Indian jets, while the match also featured a heated exchange between Rauf and Indian opener Sharma, overshadowing India's victory.

title: New GST rates effective today: Full list of items with updated rates; what is cheaper & dearer?
content: New GST rates 2025 full list effective today: The Modi government's next-generation GST reforms take effect on September 22, 2025, coinciding with the start of Navratri. These reforms reduce tax slabs to 5% and 18%, making household items, cars, and food cheaper. Here is the full list of new item-wise GST rates:

title: H-1B visa fee hike: Musk recalls his journey, says ‘I’m in America via H-1B’
content: Amidst a significant H-1B visa fee hike in the US, an old post from Elon Musk defending the program has resurfaced. Musk previously credited the H-1B visa for his own success and the growth of companies like SpaceX and Tesla.

title: Carry-on or scary-on? You may never know what luggage can hold. Hint - skull
content: A routine security check at Tampa International Airport escalated dramatically when US Customs and Border Protection officers discovered human remains, including a skull and bones, concealed within a passenger's luggage. The traveler claimed the items were for rituals, but authorities seized and destroyed them due to health risks. Prohibited plants and undeclared cigars were also found.

title: Indigo flight delayed over 2 hours after rat spotted on plane at Kanpur airport
content: An Indigo flight from Kanpur to Delhi faced a significant delay of two hours and forty minutes when a rat was spotted in the crew cabin. Consequently, all 172 passengers were deboarded while a search operation was conducted. After the successful capture and removal of the rodent, the flight finally departed for Delhi at approximately 4:50 p.m.

title: Pakistan TV panelist suggests ‘firing bullets’ to stop India match
content: A Pakistani talk show sparked outrage after a presenter shockingly suggested violence to ensure a win against India in the Asia Cup. This disgraceful discussion overshadowed India's dominant six-wicket victory, highlighted by Abhishek Sharma's explosive innings. The incident adds to a series of controversies, raising concerns about the focus on sportsmanship amidst on-field tensions and provocative celebrations.

title: H-1B visa hike: ‘Do not live in fear,’ says Zoho founder to Indians in US
content: Following a massive H-1B visa fee hike by the US, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu advises Indian tech professionals in America to return to India and rebuild their careers. Drawing parallels with the Partition, he emphasizes India's growing opportunities and the potential for success, suggesting this reverse migration could strengthen India's tech ecosystem.

title: Watch: Speeding Lamborghini crashes into Coastal Road divider in Mumbai
content: A Lamborghini crashed into a divider on Mumbai's Coastal Road early Sunday, prompting renewed safety concerns. The driver, Atish Shah, escaped unharmed after the accident, which occurred on a slick road following rain. Industrialist Gautam Singhania shared a video of the incident, highlighting the need for stricter road safety measures.

title: Top H-1B sponsoring companies in 2025: Amazon, Microsoft and Meta leading US career opportunities
content: In 2025, H-1B visas remain crucial for foreign professionals in the US. Amazon tops the list with over 10,000 approvals. Tata Consultancy Services and Microsoft follow. Meta, Apple, and Google also secure many visas. These companies drive innovation in tech, consulting, and finance. The visas help fill skill gaps and boost the US economy.

title: Qatar opens Hajj 2026 registration with new rules, key dates, and online payment
content: Qatar has opened registration for Hajj 2026 from October 1 to 31, with a quota of 4,400 pilgrims. New rules require applicants to be medically fit, provide a health certificate, and pay a QR10,000 deposit. Registration is online via hajj.gov.qa, with approvals announced in November. The process includes updated payment options and clear deadlines to streamline pilgrim services.

title: Erika says Charlie Kirk 'died happy' with 'Mona Lisa-like half-smile'
content: Erika Kirk shared a poignant account of her husband Charlie Kirk's assassination, describing his peaceful expression. At a memorial service in Arizona, attended by figures like Donald Trump, Kirk was hailed as a hero. Erika, now leading Turning Point, expressed forgiveness towards the accused.

title: Ex-Pakistan captains rave about Abhishek & Shubman - 'Exceptional, fearless'
content: India's young batting stars, Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill, propelled their team to a dominant six-wicket victory against Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super 4 clash. Their fearless approach and exceptional skill earned praise from Pakistani legends Misbah-ul-Haq and Shoaib Malik.

title: ‘Locked me in room with snake’: UP woman accuses husband, in-laws of dowry murder bid
content: In Kanpur, a woman has accused her husband and six others of attempted murder over dowry demands. She alleges they confined her with a venomous snake on September 18, resulting in a snakebite. Despite her pleas, she was rescued by her sister and admitted to Government Ursala Hospital.

title: Trump's H-1B visa fee hikes hits IT stocks: TCS, Wipro & Infosys shares tumble
content: Indian IT stocks plummeted as the US government's unprecedented H-1B visa fee hike of $100,000 rattled the $283 billion industry. The Nifty IT index plunged over 3%, with Tech Mahindra, Persistent Systems, and other mid-tier firms taking the biggest hit. Investors are concerned about rising costs and squeezed margins amidst a global demand slowdown, potentially derailing any recovery.

title: Netanyahu vows to oppose UN recognition of Palestinian state
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed to oppose international efforts to recognize a Palestinian state, asserting it would endanger Israel's existence and reward terrorism. Several countries, including France, the UK, Canada, and Australia, are preparing to announce recognition of Palestinian statehood at the UN.

title: 'Fakhar out nahi tha': Akhtar slams third umpire after 'controversial' call
content: Shoaib Akhtar criticised the umpiring after Pakistan's loss to India in the Asia Cup 2025. He questioned Fakhar Zaman's dismissal, calling it a wrong decision. Akhtar highlighted the third umpire's decision despite available camera angles. Pakistan captain Salman Agha acknowledged the debatable call. India chased down the target, with Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill leading the charge.

title: Watch: Trump throws shade at Jimmy Kimmel show at Charlie Kirk's memorial
content: During a memorial speech for Charlie Kirk, Donald Trump criticized Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show, labeling it talentless and low-rated. He also condemned commentators and influencers who seemingly approved of Kirk's assassination, accusing them of hypocrisy.

title: IND vs PAK: Rashid Latif rips into Pakistan - ‘They didn’t even try to attack’
content: Former skipper Rashid Latif blasted Pakistan’s “timid” batting after their Super 4s loss to India, saying the middle order lacked intent and wasted overs. He criticised Sahibzada Farhan, Hussain Talat, and Mohammad Nawaz for slow scoring, adding, “Better to get out playing shots than waste time. That’s why I don’t trust their batting or bowling."

title: Sudden H-1B visa fee hike sparks anxiety, leaves Indian techies stranded in transit
content: President Trump's H-1B visa proclamation caused anxiety among Indian tech workers. Harish M, an existing H-1B holder, had to expedite his return to the US, while Vinay Hiremath was advised to remain in India. Google reassured its employees that current visa holders could re-enter the US without immediate concern, as the proclamation primarily affects new visas.

title: Travis Kelce’s obscene gesture signals Kansas City Chiefs’ frustration in 2025-26 season
content: Kansas City Chiefs faced a tough start to the 2025 NFL season. The team lost its first two games. Travis Kelce was fined for unsportsmanlike conduct during the Eagles game. Patrick Mahomes struggled with passing yards. The team's offense and defense faced challenges. Injuries and penalties further impacted the Chiefs' performance. Frustrations grew among players and fans.

title: Delhi Traffic advisory: key roads closed for 12 days of Ramlila
content: A grand Ramlila and Dussehra celebration at Red Fort from September 22 to October 3, 2025, is expected to draw large crowds. The Delhi Traffic Police have issued an advisory detailing road closures and diversions on Netaji Subhash Marg and Nishad Raj Marg between 5 pm and midnight daily.

title: 'Be part of self-reliant India': PM Modi's message on first day of Navratri
content: PM Narendra Modi conveyed Navratri greetings to the country. He described the festival as a period of devotion and courage. Modi emphasised the importance of 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' and 'GST Bhachat Utsav' during Navratri. He linked the GST savings festival with India's pursuit of self-reliance. The Prime Minister urged collective efforts to achieve a developed and self-reliant India.

title: 'Can be started again': What Rajnath Singh said on phase 2 & 3 of Op Sindoor - watch
content: Defence minister Rajnath Singh hinted at the potential resumption of Operation Sindoor, emphasizing that any future terrorist activities from Pakistan would be met with a strong response. He highlighted India's decisive action following the Pahalgam attack, where terror hotbeds were destroyed inside Pakistani territory.

title: Gold price prediction: What's rate outlook for September 22 - why Rs 1,08,500 is crucial level
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are projected to sustain their bullish momentum, with a buy-on-dips strategy favored amid geopolitical tensions and Federal Reserve rate cuts. Despite initial profit booking after reaching record highs, gold remains supported by a weaker dollar and uncertainties surrounding economic data.

title: Do new rules stop H-1B visa holders from traveling out of US? USCIS issues FAQs
content: The Trump administration announced a one-time $100,000 fee for new H-1B visa petitions, effective September 21, 2025. This fee won't affect existing visa holders or renewals. The government plans further H-1B reforms, including wage revisions and prioritizing high-skilled workers in the lottery, as confirmed by USCIS FAQs and White House statements.

title: ‘Didn’t hate his rivals’: Trump on how he differed from Charlie Kirk – What he said
content: President Trump honored Charlie Kirk, a conservative activist, at a memorial service, acknowledging their disagreement on wishing well for political opponents. Trump claimed Kirk's death was politically motivated, blaming a faction of the left for silencing him. He condemned the alleged gunman and those celebrating Kirk's death, while Kirk's widow forgave the perpetrator. Trump urged attendees to continue Kirk's legacy.

title: Musk makes ‘pyramid hand symbol’ at Charlie Kirk memorial service - here's what it means
content: At Charlie Kirk's memorial, Elon Musk and Donald Trump reunited, setting aside their past feud. The gathering gained attention when both Musk and Trump were seen making a pyramid hand gesture, sparking varied interpretations online. While some view it as a power symbol, others suggest it signifies alignment after their earlier disputes.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down over 300 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Monday as IT stocks tanked following Donald Trump administration’s H-1B visa fee hike to $100,000.

title: 'You talk, we win' - Abhishek Sharma's sly dig at Pakistan after fiery win
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive 74 propelled India to a six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Super Four stage of the Asia Cup, marking their second win against their rivals in eight days. Sharma's aggressive approach and on-field exchanges with Pakistani players fueled the intense match, further highlighted by his post-match social media dig.

title: 'Family unhappy with relationship': MP woman practising garba abducted at gunpoint
content: In Mandsaur, a woman was abducted at gunpoint during a garba rehearsal, causing widespread panic. Prompt police intervention led to her rescue in Shamgarh, about 80 km away. Investigations revealed the abduction was orchestrated by her relatives, who disapproved of her live-in relationship following her separation from her husband due to his alcoholism and violent behavior.

title: 2 dead, 4 critically injured as speeding Thar rams e-rickshaw in Lucknow
content: In Lucknow's Cantonment area, a speeding SUV driven by 19-year-old Akshay Pratap Singh, a Merchant Navy student, collided with an e-auto carrying devotees, resulting in two fatalities and critical injuries to four others.

title: Fantasy Football Buzz: Benson will be a top waiver wire priority on Tuesday
content: fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . second-year player Trey Benson will take over as the Cardinals' presumed every-down back . he managed 5.4 yards per carry with a 19% explosive play rate .

title: Best of NFL Week 3's arrivals, featuring Patrick Mahomes' clean suit before 'SNF'
content: the pregame tunnel turned into a red carpet runway in Week 3 . seasoned vets and rookies showed out in looks that ranged from sharp suits to effortless streetwear . the most stylish arrivals from week 3 include quarterback patrick mahomes .

title: Updated SP+ rankings for all 136 FBS teams
content: Paul Finebaum explains why he's all-in on Miami as a true championship contender . it's a tempo- and opponent-adjusted measure of college football efficiency . if you're lucky or unimpressive in a win, your rating will probably fall .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: the WNBA semifinals are underway, and the sixth-seeded Indiana Fever made a statement in the opening game . the higher seed will host games 1, 2, 5 and 7 for the first time . it will expand to a best-of-seven series (2-2-1-1-1) .

title: Owner of Raiders, Aces goes pink for Wilson's MVP surprise
content: a'ja Wilson was presented the WNBA MVP trophy with a surprise from her boyfriend . a pair of supporters also showed up for the league's first-ever four-time MVP . the two wore pink wigs in tribute to the pink hair A'ja wore on media day .

title: Latest projections for all 46 postseason CFB games
content: the five highest-ranked conference champions will make the field . the other eight teams will meet in first-round games at the campus sites of seeds Nos. 5 through 8 . this season's national championship game will be played in the new year's six bowls .

title: Wrestlepalooza grades: Did Rhodes-McIntyre, Cena-Lesnar get above-average marks?
content: the era of WWE Premium Live Events kicked off with Wrestlepalooza from Gainbridge Fieldhouse in Indianapolis . a new women's world champion was crowned as Stephanie Vaquer defeated Iyo Sky in an excellent showdown . the card also featured the return of former WWE Divas Champion AJ Lee .

title: 60K club: Aaron Rodgers jumps to sixth all time, Matthew Stafford eyes ninth
content: Aaron Rodgers became the ninth quarterback to throw for 60,000 regular-season passing yards . he threw for 245 yards in the win against the Houston Texans . the Rams chose to rest him ahead of their playoff run .
